metadata.Title: CVE-2018-17234 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Memory leak in the H5O__chunk_deserialize() function in H5Ocache.c in the HDF HDF5 through 1.10.3 library allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a crafted HDF5 file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17234` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

hdf5-helpers - 1.8.11-5ubuntu7.1+esm2
hdf5-tools - 1.8.11-5ubuntu7.1+esm2
libhdf5-7 - 1.8.11-5ubuntu7.1+esm2
libhdf5-mpich2-7 - 1.8.11-5ubuntu7.1+esm2
libhdf5-openmpi-7 - 1.8.11-5ubuntu7.1+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: hdf5 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.11-5ubuntu7.1+esm2').
